unnormalised: RBI has mandated linking Aadhaar no. with bank accounts by 31/12/2024. This directive aims to enhance KYC norms and curb fraudulent activities in the banking sector. Earlier this year, there were reports of fake PAN cards being used for opening multiple accounts, leading to financial irregularities.
normalised: R-B-I has mandated linking Aadhaar number with bank accounts by thirty first december two thousand and twenty four. This directive aims to enhance K-Y-C norms and curb fraudulent activities in the banking sector. Earlier this year, there were reports of fake P-A-N cards being used for opening multiple accounts, leading to financial irregularities.

unnormalised: The move is expected to bring greater transparency and accountability to financial transactions. Individuals holding accounts across various banks like SBI, HDFC, and ICICI will need to comply. Failing to do so might result in account freezing, said sources from the Finance Ministry. Customers are advised to visit their nearest branch or use online banking facilities for linking their 12-digit Aadhaar ID to their respective accounts.
normalised: The move is expected to bring greater transparency and accountability to financial transactions. Individuals holding accounts across various banks like S-B-I, H-D-F-C, and I-C-I-C-I will need to comply. Failing to do so might result in account freezing, said sources from the Finance Ministry. Customers are advised to visit their nearest branch or use online banking facilities for linking their twelve digit Aadhaar I-D to their respective accounts.

unnormalised: Financial experts believe this step will significantly improve the detection of shell companies and illicit fund transfers. Banks will be able to use Aadhaar as a primary identifier, enabling them to verify the identity of account holders more effectively. The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) has assured citizens that data security will be a top priority and that all information shared will be protected in accordance with existing regulations.

unnormalised: Concerns regarding privacy have been raised by some, but government officials have emphasized that only essential information will be shared with banks, and strict protocols will be in place to prevent misuse. The integration of the IFSC code with each linked account will further streamline the process of tracking financial flows, bolstering efforts to combat money laundering and other financial crimes.
